newsitem.title: USA: AOL venture Digital City buys NY Web firm.
newsitem.headline: AOL venture Digital City buys NY Web firm.

text.p: Digital City Inc., a jointly owned venture of America Online Inc. and media giant Tribune Co., said Monday it acquired the key assets of Web site developer WP Studio as part of its move to set up a major Web site about New York.
Terms of the deal were not disclosed.

WP Studio, founded in 1994 as a division of Web Partners Llc, has developed a few Web sites, including Total New York, a site for entertainment, new media and cultural information about New York City.
The Digital City venture is aimed at providing news, sports, weather, traffic, tourist data, entertainment and other localised information on 13 U.S. cities.
Digital City will begin developing Digital City New York, which will be launched later this year. Additional cities are planned for 1997 and beyond.
The other Web sites developed by WP Studio include ada'web, which was launched to produce original art projects on the Web, and Spanker, a satirical look at personal Web pages on the Internet.
The companies said these Web sites will become productions of Digital Cities Studio and they will produce original programming content for all of Digital City's city sites.
